official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and the Social
		  Security Act to provide for employment tax treatment of professional service
		  businesses.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Narrowing Exceptions for Withholding
			 Taxes Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Employment tax
			 treatment of professional service businesses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 subsection:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1402 of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text:
Special rules
				for professional service businesses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall take into account such shareholder’s pro rata share of
				all items of income or loss described in

which are attributable to
				such business in determining the shareholder’s net earnings from
				self-employment.

text.#text:
In the case of any disqualified S corporation, each
				shareholder of such disqualified S corporation who provides substantial
				services with respect to the professional service business referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the shareholder’s pro rata share of items
				referred to in

shall be increased by the pro rata share of
				such items of each member of such shareholder’s family (within the meaning of

) who does not provide substantial services with respect to
				such professional service business.

text.#text:
Except as
				otherwise provided by the

any S corporation
				which is a partner in a partnership which is engaged in a professional service
				business if substantially all of the activities of such S corporation are
				performed in connection with such partnership, and

any other S
				corporation which is engaged in a professional service business if the
				principal asset of such business is the reputation and skill of 3 or fewer
				employees.
For purposes of this subsection, the term

header.#text:
Shareholders
				providing services to disqualified S corporations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not apply to any partner who provides
				substantial services with respect to such professional service business.

text.#text:
In
				the case of any partnership which is engaged in a professional service
				business,

term.#tail:
means any trade or business if
				substantially all of the activities of such trade or business involve providing
				services in the fields of health, law, lobbying, engineering, architecture,
				accounting, actuarial science, performing arts, consulting, athletics,
				investment advice or management, or brokerage services.

text.#text: For purposes of this subsection, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary or appropriate
				to carry out the purposes of this subsection, including regulations which
				prevent the avoidance of the purposes of this subsection through tiered
				entities or otherwise.
